summary:
It is an honour to work at Deltares with a group of motivated researchers, advisors and specialists who basically live their profession and daily strive to make positive impacts on society and industry. The work at Hydraulics for Infrastructure & Industry is about vital infrastructure. We maintain, grow and share a strong knowledge base in optimizing designs, reducing energy use, reducing risks of (critical) failures, minimizing impacts. What do I do? I try to facilitate the department to my best abilities: creating good boundary conditions, stimulate the team in their development and project execution, business development, setting out strategies and working out business plans, quality assurance and reviewing, sometimes a project. profile_positions.description: The Netherlands and South Korea share many similar challenges in the fields of water, subsoil and infrastructure. Typical examples are dealing with effects of climate change, coastal erosion, maintaining good water quality, dike stability, salt intrusion, sustainable energy, algae blooms, cooling water use, governance, flood plain management, wetland restoration etc. That is a lot!!! For Deltares, I enjoy setting up  and maintaining relations with Korean researchers and engineers. Key focus is to jointly address challenges in R&D and commercial projects and grow our knowledge levels. Relations have been established with key research institutes and universities as well as with large engineering companies and water companies. It is great to create knowledge networks between Deltares' experts and Korean counterparts and to get fruitful cooperation off the ground. Next to coordination, I help our specialists with doing business in East Asia and understanding (business) culture.

profile_positions.description: I have been managing the Industrial Hydrodynamics department of Deltares for just over two years. This means that next to Intake & Outfall Systems, Pumping Stations, Hydraulics of Pipeline Systems, Tidal Energy and Heat Networks, I will broaden my personal scope and work on great Locks and Sluices projects with the team. profile_positions.description:
PIANC is the world association for waterborne transport infrastructure. The organisation PIANC was founded in 1885. It concentrates on design, construction, maintenance and operation of waterways and ports, coastal engineering, dredging, environment, sea and inland shipping as well as recreational sailing and marinas. PIANC is a non-profit politically independent  organisation and forms a platform for knowledge exchange on the above topics. Experts from all over the World work in dedicated PIANC working groups on reliable , cost-effective and sustainable solutions and guidelines for waterborne transport infrastructure.

The PIANC board consists of the main players in the field in the Netherlands with representatives from the main ports, engineering companies, dredgers, universities, government and research institutes.
As Secretary of the Board, my role is to connect to all board members, keeping everybody up to date, and to keep the organisation running.
